name: Takashi Abiko
body:
# GIS WORKS

##Beach Sand/Sediment Transport Research
Analysis of the Morro Bay Littoral Cell and associated hydrologic sub-units.  This map supplemented graduate research in geology, to identify sediment sources and to find out why there is a greater net erosion than net accretion of beach sand along this coastline.

![Beach Sand/Sediment Transport Research](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/MLBC.Small.CartographicDesign.FinalProject_zps3ou0ksih.jpg~original)


##Naturally Occurring Asbestos in San Luis Obispo County
This is a series of maps showing Naturally Occurring Asbestos Potential Hazard Zones in San Luis Obispo County, the Morro Bay region, and within the City of San Luis Obispo.

![Naturally Occurring Asbestos in San Luis Obispo County](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/SLOCounty.NOAHazard.Geologic.Map_zpsnjpnj2nt.jpg~original)

![Naturally Occurring Asbestos in San Luis Obispo County](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/MBRegion.NOAHazard_zps8vqrv90u.jpg~original)

![Naturally Occurring Asbestos in San Luis Obispo County](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/MBNorth.NOAHazard_zps71hwgqcm.jpg~original)


##Landslide Analysis Map
Landslides and their activity levels along a highway corridor.

![Landslide Analysis Map](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/Abiko.GIS4685.FinalMap_zpsvgfcejfh.jpg~original)


##Viewshed Analysis
A viewshed analysis of the valley through Telluride, CO, including 3D visualization and line of sight profile.

![Viewshed Analysis](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/3D.Viz.ViewshedAnalysis_zpsnegobxwo.jpg~original)


##Watershed Groundwater Protection
Areas likely to possess greater influence in the Mammoth Cave Watershed's groundwater quality.

![Watershed Groundwater Protection](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/Groundwater.Protection.Model_zpsfm9ittcg.jpg~original)


##Suitable Grizzly Bear Habitat
Simulated analysis of habitat in Colorado that could be suitable for the re-introduction of Grizzly Bears

![Suitable Grizzly Bear Habitat](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/Grizzly.Habitat.Map_zpsogzh2ryl.jpg~original)


##Slope and Fuel Hazard Map
Slope and fuel analysis of Temescal Creek, utlizing NFPA Hazard Points 

![Slope and Fuel Hazard Map](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/Fire.SlopeFuel.Map_zpswkuwgsca.jpg~original)


##Terrain Map
A map of the landforms to show the terrain in an area of Glacier National Park.  Topographic lines were geoprocessed from DEM.

![Terrain Map](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/Topographic.Glacial.Terrain_zps2lnmfvlr.jpg~original)


##Digital Image Processing 
Utilizing MicroImages (TNTmips Digital Image Processing Software) for street and land use imaging; georegistration and resampling; and, viewshed analysis.

![Digital Image Processing](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/TNTmips.Sample1_zps18fe38ks.png~original)

![Digital Image Processing](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/TNTmips.Sample2_zpswvq4kbvy.png~original)

![Digital Image Processing](http://i1301.photobucket.com/albums/ag102/takashiabiko/TNTmips.Sample3_zpsuv5awnr6.png~original)


#[Graphic Design Portfolio Next](http://tabiko.github.io/Graphic-Design-Portfolio/)
